content: My name is Shashank Shekhar. I am a final-year Electronics and Communication Engineering student at IIT (I S M) Dhanbad, with a strong focus on software engineering, data structures and algorithms, full-stack web development, and AI agents.

I am currently pursuing my degree in Electronics and Communication Engineering, where I have developed strong problem-solving skills through data structures, algorithms, and core computer science subjects.
My greatest strength is my ability to break down complex problems into smaller, manageable components and arrive at efficient solutions. I am also adaptable and learn new technologies quickly.
I sometimes spend more time optimizing solutions than necessary early on. I am consciously improving at prioritizing correctness and clarity first, and optimizing once the solution is stable.
I have hands-on experience with C++ for data structures and algorithms, as well as JavaScript-based backend development using Node.js and frontend development with React.

I have worked on multiple web-based projects, including an AI-driven email writing and sending application where users can generate emails from prompts, and other full-stack applications focused on practical problem-solving.
I actively practice data structures and algorithms, with a focus on writing efficient, clean solutions and understanding trade-offs between time and space complexity.
I am particularly interested in backend systems, AI agents, and building web applications that combine clean system design with intelligent automation.
I learn best by building and solving problems. I prefer applying concepts through projects and coding challenges rather than relying only on theoretical understanding.
I believe in writing clean, maintainable code. Code should be easy to read, reason about, and extend, especially in collaborative environments.
I take ownership of my work and am comfortable working independently. At the same time, I value feedback and collaboration as a way to improve both my code and my thinking.

When solving a problem, I first focus on understanding constraints and edge cases before jumping into code. I prefer starting with a simple, correct solution and then iterating toward efficiency and clarity.
I try to communicate my ideas clearly and logically, especially when discussing technical topics. I value being concise but thorough, and I ask clarifying questions when requirements are ambiguous.

When I face a difficult problem or a setback, I break it down, research possible approaches, and iterate until I understand the root cause. I see challenges as learning opportunities rather than blockers.
I regularly reflect on my work to identify areas where I can improve, whether it is technical depth, communication, or time management. I actively seek feedback and try to apply it in future work.
I am aiming for a software engineering role where I can work on challenging problems, contribute to system design, and continuously grow my technical skills.

I learn best by doing. I prefer hands-on projects, coding challenges, and real-world problem-solving over purely theoretical study. I also find value in explaining concepts to others as a way to solidify my own understanding.

I am particularly interested in backend systems, AI agents, and building web applications that combine clean system design with intelligent automation. I enjoy working with Node.js, React, and modern development tools.

I work well both independently and in team environments. I respect different perspectives, enjoy technical discussions, and believe good collaboration leads to better system design and cleaner solutions.

When making technical decisions, I consider trade-offs between simplicity, performance, and maintainability. I prefer solutions that are easy to reason about and scale over overly complex optimizations.
When working with AI systems, I am mindful of correctness, misuse, and over-reliance on automation. I believe AI should assist human decision-making, not replace critical thinking.
